intro: Clerodendrum lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf glorybower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Clerodendrum lanceolatum is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
